lines.info: Eastern Gray Squirrel, simply the gray squirrel, is native to eastern North America. They are all over in NYC, especially in Astoria Park!
Gray Wolves. Today gray wolves have populations in Alaska, northern Michigan, nothernIdaho, western Montana, and the Yellowstone area of Wyoming.
American Red Wolves. With about 35 individuals left in the wild in 2023. The most critically endangered wolf in the entire world.
The Moose. The tallest and second-largest land mammal in North America. In some areas, moose are the primary source of food for wolves.
The Canada Goose. Known for its fall migration, they will be flying south from their native land of Canada to overwinter in the United States.
The reason Canada geese do migration is for food availability. They can go up to 1,500 miles and fly about 30 miles an hour.
